An extremely rare and expensive military model of a PDA, created specifically for the order of some military stalkers. This PDA has excellent environmental protection, which makes it extremely reliable. The PDA is essential for daily information sharing. It comes with pre-installed GPS module to provide geolocation and time information to the user. The module in this version is the most advanced one - it can retrieve and process the position of all other modules connected to the network - such features make this PDA model extremely desirable among absolutely all stalkers, but only a few can get it. Unlike usual GPS modules, this one relies on sets of special codes that allows the module to acquire special privileges on the connected channel to acquire all available information.

An industrial-grade military model of the GETAC PS535E PDA, originally used by military engineering units and reconnaissance personnel for field operations in harsh but predictable conditions, is built with a reinforced housing and a weather-resistant display. The manufacturer of the PDA is the Taiwanese company Mitac Technology Corporation, which has long specialized in the development and production of military-grade devices. PDA GETAC PS535E can intercepts cellular and network traffic of other PDAs in order to display precise location of stalkers. The device remains reliable under normal field exposure but proves totally unfit for the Zone's environment. Its power consumption is significantly higher than most other PDAs and it can only be recharged by an UPD. Technicians never repair this model due to its complexity - and, as a result, it cannot be upgraded in any way. Rarely seen around the Zone, typically used by military personnel, or occasionally supplied by high-ranking military officials and covert operatives.

An extremely rare and unique model of the Kulon PDA, which can only be obtained on the Mainland. This model is ideal for the harsh conditions of the Zone - the PDA is made of a metal case with full electromagnetic shielding and total protection from moisture and dust, which is why its breakage is possible only in theory, and the touchscreen display is made of triplex glass, which makes it impossible to damage it, and is also covered with a special weatherproof film on which among other things, there are no traces and scratches. This model also has extremely low energy consumption, which allows it to run for up to a week on a single pair of batteries. All ports for communication with the outside world (USB, PCMCIA slot, memory card ports) are covered with special plugs, and the main focus in communication with the outside world is on wireless communication - for this purpose, a special encryption key is used that cannot be hacked and thanks to which the PDA cannot be detected - however, this entails the main disadvantage of this PDA, which is that unlike the Model 2.0 and Model 3.1 PDAs, the Kulon PDA cannot rely on encryption key sets, thereby it cannot gain direct access to network-connected devices to receive data, but, it can intercept and redirect other special encryption keys, and as a result, gain access to victim GPS.

UPD

The Universal Power Device is a portable power unit about the size of a small walkie-talkie. Accepts almost any type of batteries. Utilizes every bit of energy from inserted batteries and can transfer it to other batteries through the included small thin wires. These can be connected to almost any battery, regardless of its size and typical capacity. Allows stalkers to use and handle numerous electronic devices even if they have only one battery.

Car battery

Old, rusty, but still working. Once it started cars, now it starts devices or feeds the UPD of stalkers. It's a useful thing in the Zone - unless, of course, it's discharged to zero and acid has leaked all over the backpack. There are also very ancient specimens with faded labels and swollen walls. It is better not to joke with it - you never know what has accumulated inside over the years under radiation. Take care of the terminals from oxidation, and yourself from sudden discharges.

"Pripyat" RKS-20.03 Radiometer

An electronic measuring device originally produced in the Ukrainian SSR and still manufactured in modern Ukraine. Designed for individual and collective use in measuring the equivalent dose rate of background ionizing radiation, beta radiation flux density, and specific activity in liquid and bulk substances. The device was developed in the late 1980s to early 1990s at the Korolyov Factory in Kyiv. One of the most popular household radiometers since the 1990s to the present day.

Device for measuring ionizing radiation RKSB-104

The device "RKSB-104" was produced since 1991. The "RKSB-104" device is designed to measure the ambient dose equivalent rate of gamma radiation, measure the flux density of beta radiation from surfaces of clothing contaminated with radionuclides, inspect residential and utility premises, food products, forest gifts, and measure the specific activity of the radionuclide cesium-137 in substances.
